suncertify.db

Interface DBMain

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Data

    public interface DBMain
    The DBMain interface. Defines the data access APIs for the application.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Augustine Ogundimu
    See Also:
    Data

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int create(java.lang.String[] data)
      Creates a new record in the database (possibly reusing a deleted entry).
      void delete(int recNo)
      Deletes a record, making the record number and associated fisk storage available for reuse.
      int[] find(java.lang.String[] criteria)
      Returns an array of record numbers that match the specified criteria.
      boolean isLocked(int recNo)
      Determines if a record is currenly locked.
      void lock(int recNo)
      Locks a record so that it can only be updated or deleted by this client.
      java.lang.String[] read(int recNo)
      Reads a record from the database file.
      void unlock(int recNo)
      Releases the lock on a record.
      void update(int recNo, java.lang.String[] vals)
      Modifies the fields of a record.

    • Method Detail

      • read

        java.lang.String[] read(int recNo)
                 throws RecordNotFoundException
        Reads a record from the database file.
        Parameters:
        recNo - The number for the record to be read.
        Returns:
        Returns an array where each element is a record value.
        Throws:
        RecordNotFoundException - If the record does not exist or had been deleted.

      • update

        void update(int recNo,
            java.lang.String[] vals)
     throws RecordNotFoundException
        Modifies the fields of a record.
        Parameters:
        recNo - The number of the record to be updated.
        vals - The new value for field n appears in data[n]
        Throws:
        RecordNotFoundException - If the record does not exist or had been deleted.

      • delete

        void delete(int recNo)
     throws RecordNotFoundException
        Deletes a record, making the record number and associated fisk storage available for reuse.
        Parameters:
        recNo - The number of the record to be deleted.
        Throws:
        RecordNotFoundException - If the record does not exist or had been deleted.

      • find

        int[] find(java.lang.String[] criteria)
    throws RecordNotFoundException
        Returns an array of record numbers that match the specified criteria. Field n in the database file is described by criteria[n]. A null value in criteria[n] matches any field. A non-null value in criteria[n] matches any field value that begins with criteria[n]. (For example, "Fred" matches "Fred" or "Freddy".
        Parameters:
        criteria - An array of String objects.
        Returns:
        An array of record numbers.
        Throws:
        RecordNotFoundException - If no record matching the specified criteria was found.

      • create

        int create(java.lang.String[] data)
    throws DuplicateKeyException
        Creates a new record in the database (possibly reusing a deleted entry). Inserts the given data, and returns the record number of the new record.
        Parameters:
        data - Values for the new record
        Returns:
        The new record number
        Throws:
        DuplicateKeyException - If a duplicate record already exists.

      • lock

        void lock(int recNo)
   throws RecordNotFoundException
        Locks a record so that it can only be updated or deleted by this client. If the specified record is already locked, the current thread gives up the CPU and consumes no CPU cycles until the record is unlocked.
        Parameters:
        recNo - The number of the record to lock.
        Throws:
        RecordNotFoundException - If the record does not exist or had been deleted.

      • unlock

        void unlock(int recNo)
     throws RecordNotFoundException
        Releases the lock on a record.
        Parameters:
        recNo - The number of the record to lock.
        Throws:
        RecordNotFoundException - If the record does not exist or had been deleted.

      • isLocked

        boolean isLocked(int recNo)
          throws RecordNotFoundException
        Determines if a record is currenly locked. Returns true if the record is locked, false otherwise.
        Parameters:
        recNo - The number of the record.
        Returns:
        A boolean value true if the record is locked and false otherwise.
        Throws:
        RecordNotFoundException - If the record does not exist or had been deleted.
